allow_port_transition_from_submitted_to_.description: should number ports be allowed to transition from submitted to scheduled?

available_module_name.description: default carrier module name to use when creating a number

carrier_modules.description: carrier modules to perform number search & ordering from

classifiers.description: regular expressions & billing names for numbers

converters.description: suffix for the KNM module to use for E164, NPAN and 1NPAN normalization of numbers

default_force_outbound.description: should we 'force_outbound' when this feature is not set on the number?

e164_converters.description: regular expressions to convert numbers to E164 format

allow.description: number features a number is allowed to edit

fetch_account_from_ports.description: should we also search ports when trying to `/identify` a number?

force_local_outbound.description: default value for 'force_outbound' for local numbers only

force_port_in_outbound.description: default value for 'force_outbound' for port_in numbers only

force_port_out_outbound.description: default value for 'force_outbound' for port_out numbers only

local_feature_override.description: overrides the filtering of external features for local numbers

maximum_search_quantity.description: maximum number of returned DIDs in a search query

number_search_timeout_ms.description: number manager number search timeout in milliseconds

parallel_jobs_count.description: number of concurrent workers that can process a migration at the same time (1=non parallel behavior, MUST be >0)

port_in_module_name.description: completed port requests will create numbers with this carrier module name

reconcile_regex.description: if a number matches this regular expression then it is reconcilable

released_state.description: state to put numbers in when they are being released and their reserve history is empty

should_age.description: Should numbers go through an aging period before being available?

should_permanently_delete.description: when disconnecting numbers, if this flag is true they will be deleted otherwise they will go back to a pool. Local numbers are not affected by this flag

time_between_accounts_ms.description: time to pause in between the processing of accounts in milliseconds

time_between_numbers_ms.description: time to pause in between the processing of numbers in milliseconds

unauthorized_numbers_lookup.description: should number search be allowed for unauthenticated API requests?
